topic: How to type-check data pipelines using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to type-check data pipelines using fastapi with Python 3.12+
response_raw:
{
  "title": "Type-Checking Data Pipelines using FastAPI with Python 3.12+",
  "summary": "This guide demonstrates how to leverage FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, to type-check data pipelines in Python 3.12+. The approach will ensure data consistency and help catch errors early during the development phase.",

  "key_points": [
    "Install required dependencies (FastAPI, Pydantic, Uvicorn)",
    "Define Pydantic model classes for input and output data",
    "Create FastAPI routes and implement type-checked endpoint functions",
    "Test the API using a tool like Postman or an HTTP client",
    "Run the application with Uvicorn"
  ],

  "code_examples": [
    {
      "language": "python",
      "code": "```\n\n\nfrom fastapi import FastAPI, HTTPException\nfrom pydantic import BaseModel\n\napp = FastAPI()\n\nclass DataIn(BaseModel):\n    field1: str\n    field2: int\n\nclass DataOut(BaseModel):\n    result: float\n\n@app.post('/process/')\ndef process(data_in: DataIn) -> DataOut:\n    # Your data pipeline logic goes here\n    result = data_in.field1.upper() + str(data_in.field2 ** 2)\n    return DataOut(result=result)\n\nif __name__ == '__main__':\n    uvicorn app:app --reload\n```"
    }
  ],

  "version_notes": [
    "Python 3.12+ is required for this example.",
    "The example uses FastAPI version 0.76.0 and Pydantic version 1.10.0",
    "Uvicorn version 0.18.3 is used to run the application"
  ],

  "caveats": [
    "Ensure that all dependencies are installed before running the code.",
    "Customize the data pipeline logic according to your specific use case.",
    "Adapt the example code for appropriate input and output data structures."
  ]
}
